ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about chamber music and how to perform with other people.
Chamber music!
Detailed knowledge of a piece of Western art music culminating in a performance, ensemble dynamic, rehearsal management
Developed my musicianship.
I continued to develop as a viola player, and learned many skills as a chamber musician and performer.

This class has continued to expand my capabilities of a chamber player. It has allowed me to deepen my skills of analysis and interpretation of classical works as well as how to rehearse and collaborate with other artists.
So many - chamber music is in some ways the ultimate musical teacher for me.
how to work effectively in groups
I gained experience playing chamber music and learned how to be a musician in the context of a piano trio.
build skills in chamber music performance through coachings, rehearsals with peers, and biweekly performances!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great class, wish we couldve met other students more often instead of just with your chamber group
Amazing course!! A chamber music rehearsal techniques seminar would also be great

Strengths: wonderful opportunity to perform important works, underrated pro is you get really close with your group, great chance to work on musicianship 
Cons: not really any..it is definitely a lot of work for .5 credit but Overall its a wonderful opportunity
I learned so much.

Our group had many setbacks related to illness and covid, but in the end we were able to pull together our piece. Perhaps access to technology (microphones) usable for online coachings could be helpful!

One of the greatest strengths of this course is the relationships you build with people. The amount of rehearsal time spent together brings groups really close together and builds the trust necessary for the making music at a high level. The coaching and mentorship from other musicians is also incredible. I have never had a negative experience in a studio class or coaching. The community is incredibly supportive. I think this course could be improved by increasing the amount of performance opportunities.

The strengths are of course the strength of the students and teachers, the friendly and supportive community, and the opportunity to play chamber music. The only weakness I can think of is that the repertoire selection is sometimes very limited. I understand that the priority is to teach students, and the standard rep might be the best option for this, but some more breadth for more established or experienced groups might be really great.

strengths: good presentation
weaknesses: random groups not always conducive to collaborative relationships

I think the weekly coachings are super helpful and the biggest strength of the course. The only thing I would suggest is sometimes I wish I could meet individually with some of the coaches so I can get some extra feedback that applies more specifically to playing my instrument.
This is one of my favorite classes at Yale! It is has incredible coaches and is a wonderful way to become a more cohesive and communicative chamber musician. I don't have any weaknesses

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you want a fun time learning chamber music, this is a great class!
YES!! Wonderful opportunity.
Absolutely- such a wonderful opportunity!!! Performing is so important for music majors and non majors alike
YES
Of course
Of course. Opportunity to play amazing music and meet amazing people.
Yes- it was a very fun course with wonderful coaches and outstanding group members- couldn't have asked for a better group and piece.
Yes! Any student interested in chamber music should take this course!
I would highly recommend this course for all students interested in performing chamber music at a high level.
Yes, if you love chamber music (or want to try it out)!
yes
Absolutely!
Yes - I would recommend this course for anyone who plays chamber music at a high level.

Yes, I'd never played chamber music before this class and I had such a great experience trying it out. The coaches are so supportive and helpful, and it's a great opportunity for personal growth as a person and musician.
Yes! If you would like to improve your chamber music skills and play with other musicians excited about chamber music!
